title: Understanding Edward Tulane: Chapter 1
description: In this lesson, students will explore the feelings and motivations of Edward Tulane, as well as important events from the first chapter. They will learn to make predictions and inferences based on the text.

prompts.input: Why do you think Edward Tulane feels the way he does at the beginning of the story?
hints: Think about how Edward is treated by Abilene. Does that affect his feelings?
Consider what kind of toy Edward is. How might that influence his emotions?

prompts.input: How do you think Edward's journey will change him as the story goes on? What clues from the first chapter help you think this?
hints: Look at the things that happen to Edward in this chapter. Do they seem important for his future?
Think about how Edward interacts with the people around him. What does that tell you about his character?
